Welcome to address book’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
main.index()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactInput, user_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactInput: Get the data from the request body

  • user_id – int: Specify the user who created the contact

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to delete

  • user_id – int: Ensure that the user is only deleting their own contacts

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to be retrieved. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

Contact: A single contact object matching the provided email address, or None if no match is found.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Filter the results by email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A single contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A contact object that has all the data from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Determine where to start the query from

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_first_name(first_name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts_by_first_name function returns a list of contacts with the given first name.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Specify the first name of the contact that we want to retrieve from our database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_last_name(last_name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts_by_last_name function returns a list of contacts with the given last name.

Parameters:

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactInput, user_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactInput: Get the data from the request body

  • user_id – int: Ensure that the user is only able to update their own contacts

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserDb, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserDb: Create a new user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.

If no user is found, None is returned.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A single user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed into the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to be used

Returns:

A user object, which is the same as what get_user_by_email returns

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the user that will be updated

  • token – str: Update the user’s refresh_token in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A coroutine object that is not awaited

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.verification_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶
The verification_email function is used to verify a user’s email address.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. db (AsyncSession): An async database session object.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms the user’s email.

This function confirms the user’s email using the token provided in the request.

Returns:

dict: A dictionary with the confirmed email.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will verify their account.

The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to verify their account. It then checks if they are already verified and returns an error message if so. If not, it sends them an email with a link that will allow them to verify their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Send an email in the background

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A dictionary with the user and a detail message

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactInput, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactInput object as input, which is defined in the models/contact.py file. The function also takes an optional db parameter, which is used to connect to the database and create a new contact record.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactInput: Validate the data sent in the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. db (AsyncSession, optional): An async session object for interacting with the database. Defaults to Depends(get_db). current_user (User, optional): A user object representing the currently logged in user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session from the dependency injection

  • current_user – User: Get the current user information from the database

Returns:

A dictionary with a detail key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Set the limit of contacts to return

  • ge – Specify that the limit must be greater than or equal to 10

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts_by_email function returns a contact by email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_first_name(first_name: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contacts_by_first_name function returns a list of contacts with the given first name.

If no contact is found, an HTTP 404 error is raised.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Get the first name from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A list of contacts, but the schema expects a single contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_id(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts_by_id function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_last_name(last_name: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contacts_by_last_name function returns a list of contacts with the specified last name.

If no contact is found, an HTTP 404 Not Found error is raised.

Parameters:

  • last_name – str: Pass the last name of a contact to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

The function uses the get_contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays function from the repositories/contact.py file to query for contacts with upcoming birthdays and then returns those results.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactInput, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactInput): The updated information for the specified Contact.

Returns:

Contact: A dictionary containing all of the information for a specific Contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • body – ContactInput: Pass the data to the update_contact function

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Returns the current user’s information.

This function retrieves information about the current user based on their JWT token.

Args:

current_user (User): The current user obtained from the JWT token.

Returns:

UserDb: An object containing the current user’s information.

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Updates the user’s avatar.

This function updates the user’s avatar based on the provided image file.

Args:

file (UploadFile): The image file to be uploaded. current_user (User): The user whose avatar is being updated. db (AsyncSession): The database session to perform the operations.

Returns:

UserDb: An object containing the updated user’s information.

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '09d25e094faa6ca2556c818166b7a9563b93f7099f6f0f4caa6cf63b88e8d3e7'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token.

The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to datetime.utcnow() and exp (expiration time) claim is set to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time limit for refresh tokens

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it.

If the scope is ‘refresh_token’, then we return the email address of the user. Otherwise, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the UserController class. It takes an access token as input and returns the user object associated with it. If no user is found, or if there are any errors, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object that is associated with the jwt

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first decodes the token using jwt.decode, which is part of PyJWT, a Python library for encoding and decoding JSON Web Tokens (JWTs). If successful, it will return the email address associated with that JWT.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who requested a token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

REST API service Verification¶

async src.services.verification.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. username (str): The username of the new account being created. host (str): The hostname of the server where this function is running.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the host name of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
